title.title: Tower Bridge closure - Wednesday 23 March 2005: diversions into the congestion charging zone

texts: Tower Bridge was closed to traffic for a few hours today due to a technical problem, and some vehicles were therefore diverted into the congestion charging zone.

Vehicles following a diversion into the zone should leave by the nearest available route as soon as possible. If they do so, they should not receive a penalty charge notice (PCN) and there is no need for them to pay the Â£5 daily charge.
However, should drivers go further into the zone or stay in the zone for a prolonged period they will be expected to pay the charge.
Any driver wishing to contest a PCN should follow the representations process as outlined on the PCN.
